questions.question: Software engineers are a ............................ a dozen these days.
questions.description: Dime a dozen means very common.

questions.question: Getting injured turned out to be a blessing in ................................. because he was not summoned for military service.
questions.description: A blessing in disguise is a good thing although it may appear bad.

questions.question: Tough measures are required to save the business and as the director, you have to bite the .....................................
questions.description: To bite the bullet is to endure an unpleasant situation that cannot be avoided.

questions.question: She never beats about the .................................... when she is upset about something.
questions.description: To beat about the bush is to discuss a matter without coming to the actual point.

questions.question: He must have a .................................. on his shoulder. He has trouble getting along with people.
questions.description: To have a chip on your shoulder is to have an ingrained feeling of resentment.

questions.question: The company cut ................................ to maximize profits but that decision eventually backfired.
questions.description: To cut corners is to produce shoddy work.

questions.question: She made sure that things never got out of .................................
questions.description: To get out of hand is to get out of control.

questions.question: Don't jump the .................................. Wait for the right opportunity.
questions.description: To jump the gun is to act prematurely.

questions.question: When I met her the other day, she rubbed me the  .................................. way.
questions.description: To rub someone the wrong way is to annoy them.

questions.question: I won't let her off the ..............................
questions.description: To let someone off the hook is to release them from their responsibility.

questions.question: I can't ............................... my head around it.
questions.description: To wrap your head around something is to understand it.
